input_text:
Job Title: Pharmacy Software Engineer

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Two Point Conversions, Inc. is a leading global healthcare data company with over 30 years of experience helping migrate data for thousands of pharmacies and hospitals. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers. Be the reason we help thousands of stores convert their health care and pharmacy data seamlessly.
ResponsibilitiesCollaborates with other engineers and client-facing employees to evaluate application software and system requirements according to architecture standards (e.g. new features, enhancements, or maintenance).Performs application development, testing, and troubleshooting according to specifications in an efficient and cost-effective manner.Maintains and documents application source code using version control, wikis, and internal knowledge bases. This includes issue status tracking and documenting the resolution for future use.Participates in reverse engineering of various data formats, often at the binary level.Engages in code reviews and process improvements.Follows proper handling of sensitive data according to security policies.Reduces occurrences of vulnerabilities through proper secure coding practices and a "Security by Design" mindset.Other duties as assigned
This is a salaried, exempt position that requires a 45 hour minimum work week and available for a prescheduled on-call shift for 12-24 hour as business needs dictate. Prospective software developers will have flexible hours, the ability to work from home, and other telecommuting opportunities. Other benefits include a 401k 3% guarantee and vision/medical/dental insurance.
QualificationsHands-on experience with technologies such as SSMS, AWS Glue, Visual Studio CodeFamiliar with DevOps related technologies like Ansible, Chef, Terraform, etc.Experience as a developer throughout the full software development lifecycle.Capable of delivering on multiple competing priorities with little supervision.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.We're looking for someone with 1-3 years of experience in software development with a general purpose programming language, has a BS degree in computer science or a similar area, and is familiar with the following software/tools: Experience with Azure, Golang, and/or TypeScript with frameworks such as Angular preferredFor consideration, please apply directly to: hr@twopoint.com We are unable to provide sponsorship now or in the future. We are looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you!  Two Point Conversions, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Pharmacy Software Engineer
output_json.summary: Join a leading global healthcare data company with experience in migrating data for pharmacies and hospitals.
job_responsibilities: Collaborates with other engineers and client-facing employees to evaluate application software and system requirements.
Performs application development, testing, and troubleshooting according to specifications.
Maintains and documents application source code using version control, wikis, and internal knowledge bases.
Participates in reverse engineering of various data formats.
Engages in code reviews and process improvements.
Follows proper handling of sensitive data according to security policies.
Reduces occurrences of vulnerabilities through proper secure coding practices.
output_json.company_information: Two Point Conversions, Inc. is a leading global healthcare data company with over 30 years of experience helping migrate data for thousands of pharmacies and hospitals.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
